required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bradycardia Risk Stratification With Loop Recorder After Syncope
clinical_study.official_title: Bradycardia High Risk Patient Identification After Syncope With Loop Recorder an Observational Study in Nancy University Hospital

brief_summary.textblock:
Syncope is a common symptom that may be related to a conductive disorder. If no bradycardia is authenticated, it is often necessary to implant an implantable loop recorder.
In somes cases, implantable loop recorder records cardiac conductive disorders. In this study, we want to try to identify a group of patients for whom we could immediately implant a pacemaker without prior implantation of an implantable loop recorder given the high probability of implantation of a pacemaker after interrogation of the implantable loop recorder. It would be interesting for the reduction of interventions for the patients and for the economic aspect of the healthcare system

primary_outcome.measure: significant bradycardia whitch result with an Indication of pacemaker implantation
primary_outcome.time_frame: At the moment of enregistrement of a significative arrhythmia or at the end of the 3 years of follow up
primary_outcome.description: 2° and 3° AV block, sinus node dysfunction with pause > 8 sec or > 3sec with concomitant symptoms, sick sinus syndrom

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient group without benefit of implantation of the Implantable Loop Recorder
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of the 3 years of follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: non significant bradicardia or arythmias revealed by loop recorder during monitoring

arm_group.description: Patients implanted with a subcutaneous Loop Recorder after syncope in Nancy University Hospital

study_pop.textblock: All patients who have benefited from an Implantable Loop recorder in the Nancy's Teaching Hospital between 1 January 2010 and 31 decembre 2019

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients who have benefited from an Implantable Loop recorder in the Nancy's Teaching Hospital
Exclusion Criteria:
- No Exclusion Criteria

reference.citation: Brignole M, Moya A, de Lange FJ, Deharo JC, Elliott PM, Fanciulli A, Fedorowski A, Furlan R, Kenny RA, Martín A, Probst V, Reed MJ, Rice CP, Sutton R, Ungar A, van Dijk JG; ESC Scientific Document Group . 2018 ESC Guidelines for the diagnosis and management of syncope. Eur Heart J. 2018 Jun 1;39(21):1883-1948. doi: 10.1093/eurheartj/ehy037.

Edvardsson N, Wolff C, Tsintzos S, Rieger G, Linker NJ. Costs of unstructured investigation of unexplained syncope: insights from a micro-costing analysis of the observational PICTURE registry. Europace. 2015 Jul;17(7):1141-8. doi: 10.1093/europace/euu412. Epub 2015 Mar 10.

Padmanabhan D, Kancharla K, El-Harasis MA, Isath A, Makkar N, Noseworthy PA, Friedman PA, Cha YM, Kapa S. Diagnostic and therapeutic value of implantable loop recorder: A tertiary care center experience. Pacing Clin Electrophysiol. 2019 Jan;42(1):38-45. doi: 10.1111/pace.13533. Epub 2018 Dec 4.

patient_data.ipd_description: anonymous individual datas for baseling pre implantatory caracteristcs and clinical outecome would be available
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Data access request will be reviewed by investigator team. Requestors will be required to signe a data access agreement
